solution.text:
Let the time taken by a man be x and by a woman be y
Then:
Work done in one day by a man = \(1\over x\)
Similarly, by a woman = \(1\over y\)
Now according to question :
\(_{k}_({_{i}_\over x} + {_{j}_\over y}) = 1\)
And, _{l}_\(({_{{i+3}}_\over x} + {_{{j*2}}_\over y}) = 1\).
\(({_{i}_\over x} + {_{j}_\over y}) = {1\over _{k}_}\) ------(1)
\(({_{{i+3}}_\over x} + {_{{j*2}}_\over y}) = {1\over _{l}_}\) ------(2)
Put p = \(1\over x\) and q = \(1\over y\)
_{i}_p + _{j}_q = \({1\over _{k}_}\) -------(3)
_{{i+3}}_p + _{{j*2}}_q = \({1\over _{l}_}\) -------(4)
Multiply equation (1) by 2 to make coefficient of y equal
_{{2*i}}_p + _{{2*j}}_q = \({2\over _{k}_}\) -------(5)
Now subtract equation (4) from equation (5)
We get,
_{{i-3}}_p + _{{2*j-2*j}}_q = \({2\over _{k}_} - {1\over _{l}_}\)
_{{i-3}}_p = \(_{{2*l-k}}_\over _{{k*l}}_\)
p = \(_{{2*l-k}}_\over _{{k*l*(i-3)}}_\)
Putting p = \(_{{2*l-k}}_\over _{{k*l*(i-3)}}_\) in equation (3), we get
_{i}_\(_{{2*l-k}}_\over _{{k*l*(i-3)}}_\) + _{j}_q = \({1\over _{k}_}\)
\(_{{(2*l-k)*i}}_\over _{{k*l*(i-3)}}_\) + _{j}_q = \({1\over _{k}_}\)
_{j}_q = \({1\over _{k}_}\) - \(_{{(2*l-k)*i}}_\over _{{k*l*(i-3)}}_\)
_{j}_q = \({_{{l*(i-3)}}_-_{{(2*l-k)*i}}_}\over _{{k*l*(i-3)}}_\)
q = \({_{{l*(i-3)-(2*l-k)*i}}_}\over _{{k*l*j*(i-3)}}_\)
Now, p = \(1\over x\) = \(_{{2*l-k}}_\over _{{k*l*(i-3)}}_\)
x = \(_{{k*l*(i-3)}}_\over _{{2*l-k}}_\)
x = \(_{{trunc((Decimal(k)*l*(i-3))/(2*l-k),2)}}_\)
And, q = \(1\over y\) = \({_{{l*(i-3)-(2*l-k)*i}}_}\over _{{k*l*j*(i-3)}}_\)
y = \(_{{k*l*j*(i-3)}}_\over {_{{l*(i-3)-(2*l-k)*i}}_}\)
y = \(_{{trunc((Decimal(k)*l*j*(i-3))/(l*(i-3)-(2*l-k)*i),2)}}_\)
Thus,1 man alone can assemble the car in \(_{{trunc((Decimal(k)*l*(i-3))/(2*l-k),2)}}_\) days and 1 woman alone can do it in \(_{{trunc((Decimal(k)*l*j*(i-3))/(l*(i-3)-(2*l-k)*i),2)}}_\) days.

content.text: _{i}_ men and _{j}_ women can together assemble a car in _{k}_ days, while _{{i+3}}_ men and _{{2*j}}_ women can assemble it in _{l}_ days. Find the time taken by 1 woman alone to finish the work, and also that taken by 1 man alone.
